definition[0]: to cover or protect something with a material that stops electricity, sound, heat etc from getting in or out
example[1]: Pipes may need insulating against the cold.
definition[1]: to keep someone apart from particular experiences or influences, especially unpleasant ones
example[2]: The royal family tried to insulate him from the prying eyes of the media.
definition[2]: to keep something safe from the harmful effects of something
example[3]: Such a strategy helps insulate the portfolio from the stock marketâ€™s volatility.
